blocks.name: ax-un
blocks.content: Axiom of Union. An axiom of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. It states that a set ` y ` exists that includes the union of a given set ` x ` i.e. the collection of all members of the members of ` x ` . The variant ~ axun2 states that the union itself exists. A version with the standard abbreviation for union is ~ uniex2 . A version using class notation is ~ uniex . The union of a class ~ df-uni should not be confused with the union of two classes ~ df-un . Their relationship is shown in ~ unipr . (Contributed by NM, 23-Dec-1993.)
blocks.origin:
axiom ax-un(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}

}

blocks.name: zfun
blocks.content: Axiom of Union expressed with the fewest number of different variables. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfun(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbi(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  ax-un(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  albii(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))
  cbvexvw(hs0, s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2))), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))
  elequ2(hs0, s0, s1)
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}

blocks.name: axun2
blocks.content: A variant of the Axiom of Union ~ ax-un . For any set ` x ` , there exists a set ` y ` whose members are exactly the members of the members of ` x ` i.e. the union of ` x ` . Axiom Union of [BellMachover] p. 466. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm axun2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
} = {
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))
  ax-un(s0, s1, s2, s3)
  diff.wex.s(s0, s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(s3))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s3)
}

blocks.name: uniex2
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union using the standard abbreviation for union. Given any set ` x ` , its union ` y ` exists. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)

blocks.name: uniex
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union in class notation. This says that if ` A ` is a set i.e. ` A e. _V ` (see ~ isset ), then the union of ` A ` is also a set. Same as Axiom 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm uniex(class c0) {
  |- wcel(cuni(c0), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
} = {
  vtocl(hs0, c0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe))
  eleq1d(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  issetri(hs1, cuni(cv(hs0)))
  uniex2(hs1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: uniexg
blocks.content: The ZF Axiom of Union in class notation, in the form of a theorem instead of an inference. We use the antecedent ` A e. V ` instead of ` A e. _V ` to make the theorem more general and thus shorten some proofs; obviously the universal class constant ` _V ` is one possible substitution for class variable ` V ` . (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: unex
blocks.content: The union of two sets is a set. Corollary 5.8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 1-Jul-1994.)

blocks.name: tpex
blocks.content: An unordered triple of classes exists. (Contributed by NM, 10-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: unexb
blocks.content: Existence of union is equivalent to existence of its components. (Contributed by NM, 11-Jun-1998.)

blocks.name: abnexg
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for a class abstraction to be a proper class. The class ` F ` can be thought of as an expression in ` x ` and the abstraction appearing in the statement as the class of values ` F ` as ` x ` varies through ` A ` . Assuming the antecedents, if that class is a set, then so is the "domain" ` A ` . The converse holds without antecedent, see ~ abrexexg . Note that the second antecedent ` A. x e. A x e. F ` cannot be translated to ` A C_ F ` since ` F ` may depend on ` x ` . In applications, one may take ` F = { x } ` or ` F = ~P x ` (see ~ snnex and ~ pwnex respectively, proved from ~ abnex , which is a consequence of ~ abnexg with ` A = _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 2-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm abnexg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wi(wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))), c3), wcel(c0, universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {

blocks.name: abnex
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for a class abstraction to be a proper class. Lemma for ~ snnex and ~ pwnex . See the comment of ~ abnexg . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm abnex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wn(wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mtoi(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(universe, universe))
  vprc()
  syl2im(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(universe, universe), wral(s0, universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe))
  alral(s0, universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  biimpi(wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe))
  eleq1i(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe, cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))))
  abbii(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  bicomi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  rexv(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  abnexg(s0, s1, universe, c0, c1, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
}

  abnex(s1, s0, csn(cv(s1)), universe)

thm difex2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  sseqtri(c2, cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), cun(c0, c2))
  ssun2(c2, c0)
  eqtr2i(cun(c0, c2), cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), cun(c0, cdif(c2, c0)))

}

blocks.name: uniexr
blocks.content: Converse of the Axiom of Union. Note that it does not require ~ ax-un . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: uniexb
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union and its converse. A class is a set iff its union is a set. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: pwexr
blocks.content: Converse of the Axiom of Power Sets. Note that it does not require ~ ax-pow . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: pwexb
blocks.content: The Axiom of Power Sets and its converse. A class is a set iff its power class is a set. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: elpwpwel
blocks.content: A class belongs to a double power class if and only if its union belongs to the power class. (Contributed by BJ, 22-Jan-2023.)

blocks.name: eldifpw
blocks.content: Membership in a power class difference. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2007.)

blocks.content: A well-founded relation has no 3-cycle loops. Special case of Proposition 6.23 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 30. (Contributed by NM, 10-Apr-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jun-2015.)
